items.title: Reading
items.summary: I deeply enjoy science fiction and fantasy, especially if it's light-hearted: you can often find my nose buried in a Discworld novel.
items.content_html: I deeply enjoy science fiction and fantasy, especially if it's light-hearted: you can often find my nose buried in a Discworld novel.

items.title: Discworld MUD
items.summary: This free-to-play text-based adventure game set in the mostly-flat, circular world-supported-by-elephants-on-a-space-turtle conceived by the late Sir Terry Pratchett has been running since 1992. I had the privilege of becoming a member of the development team in 2023 and have been learning the aging C# systems…
items.content_html:
This free-to-play text-based adventure game set in the mostly-flat, circular world-supported-by-elephants-on-a-space-turtle conceived by the late Sir Terry Pratchett has been running since 1992. I had the privilege of becoming a member of the development team in 2023 and have been learning the aging C# systems for creating content therein.

The development team is incredibly encouraging and welcoming to new developers, and the community still thrives after 30 years, with things like Kefka's map & item database (left, the map of Ankh-Morpork) or Quow's dedicated MUSHclient package replete with various plugins that allow the playerbase to engage with a number of QoL improvements.

I plan to contribute to this project for as long as it is operational.

GNU Terry Pratchett.

items.title: Opus 2
items.summary: I started at Opus 2 in 2012 as a temp. Within half a year I was in their technical team, delivering hardware solutions for court and arbitration transcriptions, and helping pioneer the prototype of their flagship product, Magnum, a unified legal proceedings platform for evidence,…
items.content_html:
I started at Opus 2 in 2012 as a temp. Within half a year I was in their technical team, delivering hardware solutions for court and arbitration transcriptions, and helping pioneer the prototype of their flagship product, Magnum, a unified legal proceedings platform for evidence, arguments, transcripts, comms, etc.

In the five years that followed, I prepared the Singapore office and trained staff in the Singapore supreme court, and provided on-site assistance at private arbitration sites including Osaka, Miami, Geneva, the Hague, and even St. Vincent & the Grenadines.

When I was not globetrotting or working in the courts, I provided internal IT support, assisted with production and delivery of printed and digital transcripts, produced 3D marketing videos to demonstrate new product solutions, and kept morale up running after-hours tabletop games nights midweek.

I departed Opus 2 in 2017 when I was headhunted by a different firm.
